Description: Romania is in the process of establishing a national AI strategy. A draft document was proposed by mid-October 2019, followed by consultations with stakeholders in academia (October), in all branches of public administration (November 2019) and the general public (December 2019), with the strategy forecasted for adoption by the end of Q1 2020.
Objective(s): The adoption of the Government of a national AI strategy.
Responsible organisation(s): Ministry for Communications and Information Society (MCSI;Ministerul Comunicatiilor si Societatii Informationale)
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Degree of coordination in implementing strategy (select the highest that applies): 1- Strategy communicated to public bodies|Focuses on the following area(s) of the national innovation system: Governance|Follow-up mechanism: Periodic monitoring and/or evaluation of progress|Foresight exercise included: Yes|Societal challenge(s) emphasised: Other|Specific business sector(s) targeted: Electronics|Strategy mainly prioritises: Business innovation and innovative entrepreneurship
